results.title: Sigaalow: Town of dust
results.creator_credit: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, United Nations and Leslie Jenkins
results.brief_description: Examines the problems relating to living conditions faced by Somalian refugees from the Ogaden. Shows the efforts being made by the Somali government to deal with these problems and the need for International Aid.

results.title: Sierra Leone greets the Queen
results.brief_description: Royal tour of Sierra Leone by Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II, and HRH Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh, in 1961; State Drive to Freetown; a military parade and inspection, a Royal Durbar, a State Banquet and the Garden Party given for Her Majesty by Prime Minister, Sir Milton Margai. Visits to outstanding industrial projects and educational institutions and a wealth of colourful pageants and displays are other features of the tour.
results.description: Royal tour of Sierra Leone by Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II, and HRH Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh, in 1961; State Drive to Freetown; a military parade and inspection, a Royal Durbar, a State Banquet and the Garden Party given for Her Majesty by Prime Minister, Sir Milton Margai. Visits to outstanding industrial projects and educational institutions and a wealth of colourful pageants and displays are other features of the tour.

results.title: Sidney Nolan: Such Is Life
results.creator_credit: William Leeson, Waveband Film Productions, RM Arts, Ceidrik Heward, Radio-Telefis Eirann (RTE), Channel 4 and Brian Adams
results.brief_description: Such is life is a biographical retrospective of Sidney Nolan’s life and work, told in a modern-day journey from Ireland to England, Hong Kong and Australia. Filmed against a background of Sidney Nolan’s past and current projects, it includes the designs for a new opera production for the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden, a large graphic suite on themes relevant to Australia’s Bicentennial during 1988 and exhibitions of his new work in London and Hong Kong.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Leeson, Waveband Film Productions, RM Arts, Ceidrik Heward, Radio-Telefis Eirann (RTE), Channel 4 and Brian Adams

results.title: Sidney Nolan, Mary Nolan: An Australian dream
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Don Bennetts
results.brief_description: This documentary looks at the history of Australia through the work of artist Sidney Nolan. Discussed is the 18th century and the exploration of Australia by the Europeans, convict settlement, gold discovery through to multiculturalism of the 20th century. Narrated by Frederick Parslow with script written by Elwyn Lynn ‘An Australian dream’ also shows historic footage of Nolan and his exhibition at Heide Museum of Modern Art including music by Percy Grainger on piano roll courtesy of the Grainger Museum.
results.title_for_label: Sidney Nolan, Mary Nolan: An Australian dream

results.title: Side show
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Features Marcel Marceau in a pantomine of circus performers demonstrating their skills: a juggler, an acrobat, clowns pulling ropes, and a tightrope walker. From the series “The Art of silence”.

results.title: Side by side: prejudice
results.brief_description: Friction occurs between two girlfriends - one white, the other Chinese - when the white girl’s boyfriend does not invite the chinese girl to the exclusive Country Club because of her nationality. Raises issues surrounding the values of frienship, and irrational prejudices. No other credits available.

results.title: Sick puppy [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Sally Chesher, Bellwether Films and Bruce Hancock
results.brief_description: A young boy’s puppy is dying. Anxious not to distress him, his father promises to take him to the circus (All New Moscow Circus) if worst comes to worst. A surprising short about mortality, parenthood and priorities. Cast includes Helen Thomson, David Woodley and Carl Snell.

results.title: Sibling rivalries and parents
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”.
Rivalry among brothers and sisters. Reasons for this rivalry, the varied manifestations of it, and means of holding natural friction to a minimum.
